page.description: A run down of available types of Input and Output.

section.description: For input/output via a web service, please refer to [Data Integration]. For output via report or charts, see [Reports].

section.title: Supported Input
section.description: Most business applications involve the collection of data, often in different formats. Alpha Anywhere can be used to capture a wide variety of data, listed below. So input methods make more sense for mobile devices, such as GPS capture, while others are generally used for web applications, such as the importing spreadsheet files.

case.title: Text and Numbers
case.description: Alpha can capture text, numbers, and special characters from a keyboard or from a virtual keyboard (like the iPhone keyboard). It is also possible to create customized virtual keyboards to make data entry more efficient.

case.title: Images
case.description: Alpha can generate the code you need to capture images or select and upload images from a web application or a mobile device.

case.title: Data From Files
case.description: Alpha can import data from CSV files, MS Access Files, MS Excel files, and other types of files. You can also write a custom routine to import data from virtually any type of file.

case.title: Documents
case.description: Documents in PDF, TIFF, or any other format can be saved as individual files on a server, in a database, or on the cloud via a web service.

case.title: Audio and Video
case.description: Alpha Anywhere applications can capture audio and video from the client device. Files can be saved on the local device, individually on the server or to a cloud service.

case.title: GPS and Maps
case.description: Geographical information can be captured by accessing the GPS system of the client device. It can also be captured by dragging markers on a map.

case.title: Digital Ink
case.description: You can capture notes and drawing entered on touch screen by a finger or stylus. The imported is stored as a scalable vector graphic, which can be edited.

case.title: Signature Capture
case.description: Signature capture is a digital ink control designed to allow someone to sign their name using a finger or stylus.

case.title: Email
case.description: Alpha Anywhere has many built in Xbasic functions for sending and receiving email.

case.title: PDF
case.description: Alpha Anywhere allows you to create [PDF reports] which you can display in a browser, email, or download.. It also allows you to create and manipulate PDF files using Xbasic and action scripting. Alpha Anywhere also includes a variety of [Xbasic functions for creating and manipulating PDF files].

case.title: Microsoft Office Excel
case.description: Alpha Anywhere allows you to generate and add to [Microsoft Excel Spreadsheets]

case.title: Text Files (including CSV, XML, and JSON)
case.description: Alpha has built in Xbasic functions for creating text files including RTF, CSV, XML and JSON files.
Plain Text - see [File Functions] and [FILE Methods]
CSV - see the [Export to ASCII Features for Grid Components]
XML - There are two functions that can be helpful for XML output: [JSON to XML], which converts a JSON object to XML, and [HTTP_POST_PAGE2], which allows you to send XML to a web service.
RTF - Alpha Anywhere has a large collection of [RTF Functions and Methods] that allow you to programmatically create and work with rich text files.
